name: Schwarzschild Radius (Event Horizon)
explanation: Schwarzschild radius is distance from black hole center where escape velocity equals light speed. Inside this radius (event horizon), nothing can escape, not even light. R_s = 2GM/c². Determines black hole size. Used to understand black holes, gravitational collapse, and extreme gravity. Fundamental to general relativity.

examples.problem: What is Schwarzschild radius for Sun? (M = 2×10³⁰ kg)
Why don't we see black holes directly?
examples.solution: Light cannot escape event horizon, so black holes are invisible
steps: Inside event horizon: escape velocity > c
Black holes visible only by effects on nearby matter
Accretion disks, gravitational lensing reveal them

proof: R_s = 2GM/c². Derived from escape velocity: set v_escape = c. From v = √(2GM/r), setting v = c gives: c = √(2GM/R_s), so c² = 2GM/R_s, therefore R_s = 2GM/c². Inside this radius, escape velocity exceeds light speed.
